Research

My research is primarily interested with discrete descriptions of quantum space-time and quantum gravity. I’m also very interested in the application of non-commutative geometry to other areas of physics such as condensed matter systems and topological phases of matter.

Publications

  • PhD Thesis: Spectral Geometry of Fuzzy Spaces. Paul Druce: University of Nottingham (2020) PDF here
  • Spectral estimators for finite non-commutative geometries. Barrett,J., Druce,P., Glaser, L.: J Phys Math Theor. 52, 275203 (2019). doi:10.1088/1751-8121/ab22f8

Google Scholar, INSPIRE-HEP, ORCID

Research notes and documents

  • Notes on Geometric Quantisation: A footing in Geometric Quantisation
  • Notes from a random seminar I went to in 2018. This was mainly to test my workflow for putting notes on the web.: Strong Quantum Energy Conditions and Hawking Singularity Theorems by Eleni Kontou (University of York)
  • A report I made at the end of the second year of my PhD, summarising recent developments.: Second Year Report
  • The slides from a talk given at Radboud University, Nijmegen in April 2017: Nijmegen Talk Slides
  • A report made at the end of the first year of my PhD outlining the motivation and background of the project.: First Year Report
